citations.narrative:
The facility has a Contingency Plan in place to address the humane handling and care of their animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster, and their Plan includes the names of the individuals who are responsible for fulfilling the different
tasks described in the Plan. However, some of the individuals who are listed by name in the current Plan are no longer
affiliated with the facility and therefore these individuals are no longer available to perform the duties described in the Plan
in an emergency or disaster.
Per this Section, exhibitors must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling,
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster (one which could
reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and well-being of the animals in their
possession). The Contingency Plans must also identify a chain of command and who (by name or by position title) will be
responsible for fulfilling these tasks. Whenever a Plan includes the names of individuals who are responsible for fulfilling
the tasks, the individuals named should be individuals who are currently affiliated with the facility to ensure that the tasks
described for emergency situations are performed. The facility needs to update the Plan to reflect individuals who are
currently affiliated with the facility. Correct by 10/10/25.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
